intro: Memecylon biokoense, commonly known as the Bioko memecylon, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Bioko in Equatorial Guinea. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests and is often found in secondary vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
